author: Deb Belt
title: 'Eggflation': Why Are Eggs So Expensive In VA, When Will Cost Go Down?
text:
Business & Tech
‚ÄòEggflation‚Äô: Why Are Eggs So Expensive In VA, When Will Cost Go Down?
If projections play out, egg prices could increase another 20 percent by the end of 2025 because of a resurgence of the bird flu in VA.
VIRGINIA ‚Äî Bird flu is a primary driver of the higher prices Virginia consumers have been paying for eggs and, if experts are right, will continue to pay.
The Labor Department‚Äôs December inflation report showed the price of a dozen Grade A eggs rose to $4.15 in December, up from about $3.30 in October. In some parts of the country, a dozen eggs can cost a buck each ‚Äî if consumers can find them.
December egg prices were 37 percent higher than they were during the same period in 2023. At the same time, the overall annual grocery inflation rate for December was 1.8 percent.
Find out what's happening in Restonfor free with the latest updates from Patch.
If projections from the Agriculture Department prove out, egg prices could increase another 20 percent by the end of 2025 because of a resurgence of bird flu.
‚ÄúNot to be the bearer of bad news, but we‚Äôre in this for a while,‚Äù Emily Metz, president and CEO of the American Egg Board, told CNN Business. ‚ÄúUntil we have time without a detection, unfortunately, this very, very tight egg supply is going to continue.‚Äù
Find out what's happening in Restonfor free with the latest updates from Patch.
We found Grade A large eggs for about $4.17 a dozen at Walmart stores and $4.19 a dozen at Target stores in Virginia. Harris Teeter was charging $5.19 a dozen for Eggland's Best eggs; Safeway was charging $5.99 a dozen for Lucerne eggs.
Organic or specialty eggs can cost even more.
In some regions, prices have exceeded $7 per dozen, particularly for organic or specialty eggs. Consumers are feeling the pinch, and experts warn that prices could climb even higher in the coming weeks as the supply chain remains strained.
Pete and Gerry's organic, free-range eggs are $7.69 a dozen, while Happy Egg's free range organic eggs are $7.49.
Below, here is what you need to know about ‚Äúeggflation‚Äù:
How Widespread Is Bird Flu?
Active investigations of avian flu outbreaks are ongoing in about two dozen states, covering everything from commercial operations to backyard flocks.
Virginia has had one outbreak this month in Accomack County that affected 441,000 birds.
Since the current outbreak began in 2022, about 135 million egg-laying hens have been destroyed. About 13 million have been euthanized since December resulting in ‚Äúrecord high‚Äù prices as producers ‚Äústruggled to provide a consistent supply to consumers,‚Äù according to the latest USDA Egg Markets Overview.
What Are Grocers Doing?
Some independent grocery stores are holding the line on egg prices as a way to build customer loyalty and push back against the perception that absent mass buying power, independent stores are too expensive.
For example, a LaBonne‚Äôs store in Watertown, Connecticut, was selling Egglands Best eggs for $3.99 a dozen earlier this month. Bob LaBonne Jr., the president and CEO of the four-store chain, told Grocery Dive the lower prices underscore the store‚Äôs commitment to affordable groceries.
‚ÄúAs a smaller store, you have the image of being high-priced. So the last thing you want to do is confirm that by being overly aggressive on trying to get margins on items that are sensitive,‚Äù LaBonne told the digital grocery news site.
The USDA said many grocery stores are putting limits on how many eggs a consumer can buy per shopping trip to stretch limited supplies and dissuade customers from panic-buying.
What Are Egg Producers Doing?
Unlike the 2015 outbreak of avian influenza spread by wild birds during migration that lasted for only a season, this one has been persistent and has spread beyond birds to dairy cattle, to cats and to people, where mutations have sparked pandemic worries.
‚ÄúBy any metric, you look at animal epizootics, basically animal-based-pandemics, this is the largest one we‚Äôve ever had,‚Äù Maurice Pitesky, an associate professor at the UC Davis School of Veterinary Medicine who focuses on highly pathogenic avian influenza and disease modeling, told Business Insider.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs in the environment. We see it in dairy lagoons. We see it in human wastewater,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúSo it's ubiquitous at this point.‚Äù
That means chickens can get bird flu from different sources, and there‚Äôs not much egg farmers can do to stop its spread. Surveillance and tracking of the virus help producers harden husbandry practices and biosecurity measures, but doing so can be expensive and drive egg prices even higher, according to experts.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre all in uncharted territory,‚Äù Brian Moscogiuri, a global trade strategist at Eggs Unlimited, a California-based egg supplier, told Business Insider, adding, ‚ÄúThe producers don‚Äôt really have a recourse.‚Äù
Are Eggs Safe To Eat?
According to guidance from the Food and Drug Administration, the chances of contaminated eggshells making it to a grocery store shelf is ‚Äúlow‚Äù and proper storage and preparation further reduce the risk.
There is no evidence the bird flu virus can be transmitted to humans through properly prepared food, according to the agency.
Eggs should be refrigerated immediately after purchase and eggs should ‚Äúuntil both the yolk and the white are firm,‚Äù the agency says. Dishes containing eggs, such as casseroles, should be cooked to 160 degrees Fahrenheit.

author: webinfo@adnkronos.com (Web Info)
title: Maltempo addio, arriva lunga Ottobrata con sole in tutta Italia: previsioni meteo
text:
(Adnkronos) - Il maltempo se ne va. Dopo i primi 10 giorni di Ottobre all'insegna di piogge, allagamenti e allerta anche rossa, √® in arrivo tanto sole con una bella Ottobrata su gran parte delll'Italia.
Antonio San√≤, fondatore de iLMeteo.it, conferma la decisa rimonta dell‚Äôalta pressione sull‚ÄôItalia con la cessazione delle forti piogge che hanno colpito soprattutto il Centro-Nord nella prima decade di Ottobre.
Nelle prossime ore avremo ancora qualche residuo addensamento specie sul Triveneto orientale, in Toscana e sul Basso Tirreno, accompagnato da locali piovaschi; per il resto il tempo sar√† in deciso miglioramento ovunque.
Le temperature scenderanno leggermente a causa di venti pi√π freschi dai quadranti settentrionali, specie al Meridione e in Sardegna, ma torneremo a percepire il calore del sole da Nord a Sud; gli ultimi 10 giorni perturbati hanno offuscato la memoria delle belle e serene giornate autunnali di una volta a molti abitanti del Centro-Nord.
Nel weekend rivivremo queste belle giornate con il sole che torner√† ad illuminare il foliage dei boschi; a tratti, il sole sar√† disturbato da correnti pi√π umide solo al Nord-Ovest e in montagna con addensamenti comunque non forieri di precipitazioni.
Lungo le coste il sole scalder√† quasi ovunque fino a valori gradevoli: sono previste massime di 28¬∞C in Sardegna e Sicilia, fino a 27¬∞C in Puglia e Calabria, 25-26¬∞C in Basilicata con Napoli e Roma a 24¬∞C, Firenze a 22¬∞C e Milano sui 20.
La media delle massime di Ottobre a Milano √® 18¬∞C, sulla Capitale 22¬∞C; entro il weekend, dunque, saliremo nelle due principali citt√† italiane di 2 gradi oltre i valori climatologici.
Addirittura, le ultime emissioni dei modelli indicano la possibilit√† della persistenza del bel tempo quasi fino alla fine del mese, con una lunga e mite Ottobrata su buona parte del Paese.
In questa proiezione meteo ottimistica non sono esclusi due veloci passaggi un po‚Äô perturbati sia venerd√¨ 18 sia venerd√¨ 25 ottobre; per il resto l‚Äôanticiclone dovrebbe dominare e fermarsi a lungo sul nostro Paese. Ovviamente si tratta di una tendenza da confermare.
Venerd√¨ 11. Al Nord: piovaschi sui monti emiliani, sole altrove. Al Centro: piovaschi sulla Toscana interna. Al Sud: nubi residue con locali piovaschi sulle tirreniche.
Sabato 12. Al Nord: nuvoloso. Al Centro: soleggiato. Al Sud: soleggiato.
Domenica 13. Al Nord: sole prevalente. Al Centro: soleggiato. Al Sud: bel tempo.
Tendenza: rinforzo dell‚Äôanticiclone, un po penalizzato il Nord.

author: VNExplorer
title: Nuova allerta gialla in Fvg per temporali forti
text: Nuova allerta gialla in Fvg per temporali forti (ANSA) - TRIESTE, 01 AGO - La Protezione civile del Fvg ha emesso un nuovo avviso di allerta meteo di colore giallo valido dalle 12 di domani fino alla mezzanotte. L'afflusso di correnti umide in quota, concomitanti con la presenza di aria calda nei bassi strati, favorir√† ancora l'instabilit√† atmosferica. Dal pomeriggio saranno possibili rovesci e temporali sulla zona montana, in successiva estensione alla pianura e, con minor probabilit√† alla costa. I temporali potranno essere localmente forti. Il verificarsi di tali eventi pu√≤ comportare locali situazioni di crisi nella rete idrografica minore e di drenaggio urbano, locali fenomeni di instabilit√† dei pendii, locali interruzioni della viabilit√† e problematiche connesse ai possibili colpi di vento durante i temporali. La Protezione civile raccomanda "la massima vigilanza sul territorio, in particolare nelle aree adibite a campeggio e in concomitanza con eventuali manifestazioni all'aperto, al fine di predisporre tempestive misure di pronto intervento". Al momento √® in gi√† in vigore un'allerta gialla per piogge e temporali, valida fino alle 3 di domani. (ANSA).

author: Denise Heady
title: Dr. Matthew Rettig recognized by VA for contributions to prostate cancer research
text:
Dr. Matthew Rettig, professor of urology and medical director of the prostate cancer program at the David Geffen School of Medicine at UCLA, has received the John B. Barnwell Award from the Department of Veterans Affairs‚Äô Office of Clinical Science Research and Development for his significant contributions to prostate cancer research and clinical practice.
The award recognizes Rettig‚Äôs commitment to improving health care for veterans, as well as his scientific leadership. Along with the honor, Rettig will receive $150,000 over the next three years in research support from the Office of Clinical Science Research and Development.
Rettig, who is also the chief of hematology-oncology at the VA Medical Center in Greater Los Angeles and co-director of the VA Precision Oncology Program for Cancer of the Prostate, is currently leveraging artificial intelligence to find better ways to predict the likelihood of metastatic recurrence amongst veterans with high-risk localized prostate cancer, a complex and heterogeneous condition where improved prognostic approaches are urgently needed.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a tremendous honor to receive this award, and I am deeply grateful for the recognition,‚Äù said Rettig, a member of the
UCLA Health Jonsson Comprehensive Cancer Center. ‚ÄúThis award underscores the importance of our collective efforts to improve health care outcomes and the quality of care for those who have served our nation.‚Äù

organizations.name: department of veterans affairs‚Äô office of clinical science research and development
office of clinical science research and development

author: @Dailyhuntapp
title: Shreyas Iyer Celebrates Mumbai's Ranji Trophy Title Win With Wild Dance; Video Goes Viral - Watch
text:
After not taking the field for the last two days of the 2024 Ranji Trophy final due to reported back pain, the star Indian batter joined his teammates to celebrate Mumbai's 42nd title victory on Thursday (March 14) with a wild dance at the Wankhede Stadium after the Ajinkya Rahane-led side's victory over Vidarbha in the summit clash. In a video that has gone viral on social media, Shreyas was spotted leading Mumbai's celebration as they ended an eight-year drought without the prestigious title. The clip showed Shreyas shaking a leg passionately with Dhol playing in the background at the iconic stadium.
Watch here
I recorded Shreyas iyer dancing after winning Ranji Trophy final! Wo üò≠üò≠üò≠‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è pic.twitter.com/dyyclpveng
‚Äî Cricket With Laresh (@Lareshhere) March 14, 2024 \n\n
Shreyas was absent from the field for Vidarbha's second inning, and reports have emerged since that the star Indian batter's back issues have flared up again. It has been suggested that the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) skipper is now doubtful for the first few games of the 2024 Indian Premier League (IPL) season.
Shreyas has faced a troubled period in his career in recent times following a back injury suffered during the 2023 Border Gavaskar Trophy (BGT), which kept him out of action for almost six months and forced him to undergo surgery.
The 29-year-old recovered in time for the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 after missing the 2023 IPL and World Test Championship (WTC) final and suffering a setback in the Asia Cup. In the mega event, Shreyas was key to India's dream run to the final, which saw him make 526 runs in 10 innings, including a century in the semi-final vs. New Zealand.
Shreyas played an important role in Mumbai's victory in the Ranji final with a quick-fire knock of 95 in 111 balls in the second innings.
Recently, Shreyas found himself in the middle of the storm after being dropped from the Indian test team and missing Mumbai's final two league stage Ranji Games and the quarter-final of the Ranji Trophy. In an unprecedented move, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) did not name him on the list of contracted players for the 2023-24 season.
